intro: Jatropha nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed physostegia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Jatropha nudicaulis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or swampy areas. It is an important species for pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
